Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingFlags..name: progress
Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingFlags..abstract: Set when the Block is called to report progress during a long-running match operation.

Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingFlags..name: completed
Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingFlags..abstract: Set when the Block is called after matching has completed.

Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingFlags..name: hitEnd
Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingFlags..abstract: Set when the current match operation reached the end of the search range.

Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingFlags..name: requiredEnd
Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingFlags..abstract: Set when the current match depended on the location of the end of the search range.

Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingFlags..name: internalError
Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingFlags..abstract: Set when matching failed due to an internal error.

Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingOption.name: reportProgress

Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingOption.name: reportCompletion
Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingOption.abstract: Call the Block once after the completion of any matching. This option has no effect for methods other than forEachMatch(in:options:range:using:). See

Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingOption.name: anchored
Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingOption.abstract: Specifies that matches are limited to those at the start of the search range. See forEachMatch(in:options:range:using:) for a description of the constant in context.

Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingOption.name: withTransparentBounds
Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingOption.abstract: Specifies that matching may examine parts of the string beyond the bounds of the search range, for purposes such as word boundary detection, lookahead, etc. This

Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingOption.name: withoutAnchoringBounds
Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingOption.abstract: Specifies that ^ and $ will not automatically match the beginning and end of the search range, but will still match the beginning and end of the entire string. This

Classes/RegularExpression/Options.html#/.name: allowCommentsAndWhitespace
Classes/RegularExpression/Options.html#/.abstract: Ignore whitespace and #-prefixed comments in the pattern.

Classes/RegularExpression/Options.html#/.name: ignoreMetacharacters
Classes/RegularExpression/Options.html#/.abstract: Treat the entire pattern as a literal string.

Classes/RegularExpression/Options.html#/.name: dotMatchesLineSeparators
Classes/RegularExpression/Options.html#/.abstract: Allow . to match any character, including line separators.

Classes/RegularExpression/Options.html#/.name: anchorsMatchLines
Classes/RegularExpression/Options.html#/.abstract: Allow ^ and $ to match the start and end of lines.

Classes/RegularExpression/Options.html#/.name: useUnixLineSeparators
Classes/RegularExpression/Options.html#/.abstract: Treat only \n as a line separator (otherwise, all standard line separators are used).

Classes/RegularExpression/Options.html#/.name: useUnicodeWordBoundaries
Classes/RegularExpression/Options.html#/.abstract: Use Unicode TR#29 to specify word boundaries (otherwise, traditional regular expression word boundaries are used).

Classes/RegularExpression/Options.html.name: Options
Classes/RegularExpression/Options.html.abstract: These constants define the regular expression options. These constants are used by init(pattern:options:).

Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingFlags..name: MatchingFlags

Classes/ThreadLocal.html.name: ThreadLocal
Classes/ThreadLocal.html.abstract: Thread Local Property Wrapper. A property marked with this wrapper will reserve storage for each thread so that the values gotten and set will only be seen by that thread.
